metadata.title: CVE-2021-30628 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Stack buffer overflow in ANGLE in Google Chrome prior to 93.0.4577.82allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit stack corruption via acrafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-30628` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 94.0.4606.71-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 94.0.4606.71-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 94.0.4606.71-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 94.0.4606.71-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 94.0.4606.71-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '94.0.4606.71-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
